title: Matt Barger
text:
For me, this site will serve a few purposes:

A passion project portfolio, detailing work in soccer analytics and other topics,
A celebration of personal accomplishments, be it my career, my golf game, or my personal life, and
A forward-facing journal of what‚Äôs going on in my life and how I‚Äôm feeling about it.

If you would like to work with me, feel free to reach out to my e-mail or any of my socials.

title: The Now
text: So this standing section will be a general reflection on what‚Äôs going in my life right now. Generally it‚Äôs a practice in mindfulness . For more information, this is a good explainer.Obligatory h/t to good friend and fellow blogger Tan Ho‚Äôs now page for my inspiration

title: What Am I Up To Right Now?
text:
Mood
Annoyed, but confident. I‚Äôve been dealing with some early-year emergencies lately (nothing I‚Äôll get into here). However, I‚Äôm pretty proud of my response so far. Upon reflection, I want to be able to handle my stress while being able to function clearly. And if I can‚Äôt, I want to be able to confront what or who is bothering me head-on, while remaining composed and affable.
Trying to be patient as possible: the problems remain stubborn and will likely stay problems for the next few months.
There will always be problems. I can control what I can control, and I can control my response to the things I can‚Äôt control.

title: What Am I Up To Right Now?
text: Created a Quarto Blog After years of hemming and hawing, I‚Äôve finally developed an online platform to host my ideas and other general musings. I‚Äôm pretty proud of it; we‚Äôll see what we can create with it.

title: What Am I Up To Right Now?
section: Things I‚Äôm Enjoying at the Moment
text:
Things I‚Äôm Enjoying at the Moment
Returning to Weightlifting from Injury
About a month ago, I had knee pain for the first time after a routine clean and jerk. Two days later, I couldn‚Äôt put pressure on my right leg. Setting up an emergency appointment, my physical therapist said a tear was unlikely: despite the pain I could still move the knee and the leg.
I limped into the holidays hoping that the knee would heal itself. It was promising: I walked 18 holes of golf with my dad, my mobility exercisees were surprisingly good. But when the pain flared up again, I bit the bullet and scheduled an orthopedist appointment, getting myself ready to accept that I‚Äôll be another 37-year-old with knee surgery.
Luckily, all x-rays were positive!
Building a Clean Home
I‚Äôve never been a tidy person; ask anyone who has lived with me. However, starting the new year with a new apartment has pushed me to challenge that assumption. This is my first new apartment in ten years! If I couldn‚Äôt keep the home clean, that fresh start would feel wasted.
Well, it took two full weekends of hard work, but I cleaned the crap out of this place. Honestly, sitting in a clean home is just ego-boosting. When I look at a tidy shelf, I feel relieved and I remind myself that I‚Äôm capable of making myself feel that way. It‚Äôs a good feeling, and it feels like something to maintain.

Other Things I‚Äôm Doing

Planning Golf Trips
 I‚Äôd love to get back to the American Soccer Golf Tour this year. Current candidates are as follows, suggestions welcome:Find me on social media and feel free to DM course suggestions!
Charleston, SC - Kiawah Island is a must for any golfer, and a Charleston Battery match seems like a must for any soccer historian.
Raleigh, NC - Tobacco Road is a must and I have to see if the NC Courage are a bigger draw than NCFC.
Louisville, KY - Renting hickory clubs and traveling back in time, then heading to a Lou City or Racing Louisville match. By the way, Racing Louisville‚Äôs houndstooth kit is absolute üî•üî•üî•.
Atlanta, GA - The soccer nerd vibes at a packed ATL United Game have been on the list since I saw the Footie Mob for the first time. Course suggestions are welcome.

title: Introducing SQD: Does Finishing Quality Matter?
text: This analysis will introduce the Shot Quality Differential (SQD) Metric, which measures the difference between a shot‚Äôs starting quality (measured as xG) and finishing quality (PSxG). It will outline different ways to analyze the statistic

title: What Am I Up To Right Now?
section: New Year, New Me More Sustainable Goals and Self-Awareness
text:
New Year, New Me More Sustainable Goals and Self-Awareness
I feel like goal-setting is natural for this month and, like most people, I rushed to improve what I saw were the worst parts of myself.
Then I reread that last sentence. Then I was sad.
For me, any kind of self-improvement comes with a counterweight of self-loathing urgency. That is, ‚ÄúI want to be able to develop this new habit, therefore I must do it immediately because everything is so awful!!!!!‚Äù This urgency comes from scarcity mindset, the idea that time is running out and if I want to be the best human possible, I need to start waking up at 6, nailing promotions and accolades, and sprinting through marathons all at the same time.
For a while, this motivation worked, but only for short-term lapses. Through tons of experience, I‚Äôve slowly learned that real progress comes through:

accepting how far I‚Äôve come (I‚Äôm not starting from scratch and I‚Äôm not an absolute failure)
celebrating my growth and learning from my mistakes (I‚Äôve already done a lot toward this goal, and I‚Äôve made plenty of mistakes, too.)
trusting myself to stay present and keep executing, leave the future for the future. (Keep doing what you need to do, opportunities will present themselves when you are ready.).

So this year, I‚Äôm not throwing out the old me. I‚Äôm staying present with the current version of myself, and buiding toward the following milestones: 1. 2.

title: The Now
section: New Year, New Me More Sustainable Goals
text:
New Year, New Me More Sustainable Goals
January is a natural goal-setting month. Like most people, I initially rushed to improve what I saw were the worst parts of myself.
Then I reread that last sentence. Then I was sad.
I once thought that the quickest way to self-improvement comes was a counterweight of self-loathing urgency. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs terribly uncommon. For me, it tends to sound like:

‚Äú[Insert Unattainable Habit to Adopt] needs to happen IMMEDIATELY because everything is so awful!!!!!‚Äù

It works, but it is also absolutely exhausting: I‚Äôve seen plenty of front-end improvement only to burn out easily and often.
Through this experience, I am beginning to learn that slow progress is lasting progress. More specifically, progress for me will require patiently re-framing my scarcity mindset, including:

accepting how far I‚Äôve come (I‚Äôm not starting from scratch. Everything is not awful.)
celebrating my growth and learning from my mistakes (In fact, everything is pretty good! I‚Äôve accomplished a ton, including many mistakes.)
trusting myself to stay present and keep executing, leave the future for the future. (The opportunities I‚Äôm chasing will present themselves often. I trust myself to be as present as possible when they arrive.).

Sneaky re-frame: Mistakes are progress!So this year, I‚Äôm not throwing out the old me. I‚Äôm staying present with the current version of myself, and building toward the following milestones:

Rebuild Back to Full Strength, Physically and Financially
My knee injury from lifting was just judged not to need an MRI (yay!). More great news is that I‚Äôve kept off the 20 pounds I lost last year during the recovery process. Looking for more, but staying patient and staying strong.

Financially I‚Äôm riding through some turbulence thanks to some early-year emergencies, but we‚Äôre getting back on track after an eventful 2023.
Keep Building Upon Healthier Habits, and Fail Often
Namely, I‚Äôm keeping my spaces clean and relatively uncluttered. We‚Äôre starting there and building out. I‚Äôm also developing the habit of writing every day, which leads to‚Ä¶
Get That Portfolio Up!
That‚Äôs the point of this website. I‚Äôve been sitting on serious soccer analysis for years, but I‚Äôve struggled to keep the ideas in my head because life is busy. Dedicating more time to documenting my process will be important and helpful. We‚Äôll see how it goes!
